page.title: 11Local History of Maylands
page.content: The area is in the Dengie Peninsula recorded as Witbrichtesherna in 1086. Home of the Daenningas folk - marshland people. {Mundon}- Munduna in 1086 possibly Anglo Saxon - a sheltering hill. {Lawling }- Laellinge in 896 Kembe Codex Diplomaticus "in quandam vocata Lallngge" - reclaimed marginal land. {Latchingdon}- Laecedune 1042-66 Westminster Domesday book. Laecen - full of water courses so "well watered hill". {Mayland}la Maylanda 1182-92 Pipe rolls. Old English "mayweed and land. Nipsells farm - Gynpesho 1230 Old English derivative "spur of land".
